SENT.plain: Morphological manifestations of vasculopathy in antiphospholipid syndrome (APLS) include necrosis, vascular thrombosis, proliferation and sclerosis in the absence of inflammation
In APLS, productive lymphocytic vasculitides may develop in line with erythematous skin lesions and erythema nodosum
Detection of nuclear pathology and vasculitis in skin biopsies can be considered as diagnostic and prognostic criteria on systemic lupus erythematosus
The above vascular changes are of immunocomplex nature
Cardiolipin antibodies participate in their genesis
